prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories:
The woman, named locally as Sarah Thompson, is cooperating with police and has provided a statement regarding the incident. It is unclear at this time if any other factors contributed to the baby's cardiac arrest.

Witnesses reported hearing the woman shouting at the baby earlier in the day, but it is unknown if this is related to the incident.

The Child Abuse Investigation Unit is appealing for anyone with information or who may have seen something suspicious to come forward.

Legoland Windsor has closed the Coastguard HQ boat ride as a precaution while the investigation continues.

The public is urged to avoid speculation and to allow the police and medical professionals to conduct their investigations in order to determine the full circumstances surrounding the incident.

Anyone with information is asked to contact Thames Valley Police on 101 quoting reference number 43210300359.

The thoughts and prayers of the Legoland Windsor community are with the family of the baby during this difficult time.

The Child Abuse Investigation Unit reassures the public that they are taking all necessary steps to understand the circumstances surrounding the incident. They encourage anyone with relevant information to come forward and share what they know.

Meanwhile, Legoland Windsor expresses its deep sympathy and support for the family involved. The park will continue to cooperate with the authorities in their investigation.

Anyone with concerns or questions is encouraged to contact Thames Valley Police or Legoland Windsor's guest services department. The park will provide updates as more information becomes available.

The investigation remains ongoing, and the public is reminded to allow the professionals to conduct their work without interference or speculation.

The Child Abuse Investigation Unit appreciates the public's patience and understanding as they work diligently to gather all the facts. Any new developments will be shared as soon as possible.

In the meantime, Legoland Windsor reaffirms its commitment to ensuring the safety and well-being of its guests. The park will remain open, but additional security measures will be in place for the safety of all visitors.

Thames Valley Police and the Child Abuse Investigation Unit can be contacted at the following numbers for any information or concerns:

Thames Valley Police - 101
Legoland Windsor Guest Services - 0871 222 2000

The investigation is ongoing, and all parties involved are asked to allow the professionals to conduct their work thoroughly and without distraction. Your cooperation is greatly appreciated.

The Child Abuse Investigation Unit expresses their gratitude for the public's continued support and understanding as they meticulously gather evidence. Rest assured, any significant updates will be communicated promptly.

In the interim, Legoland Windsor remains dedicated to the safety and enjoyment of its guests. The park's management reiterates their commitment to providing a secure environment for all visitors. Additional security measures have been implemented for everyone's peace of mind.

For any inquiries or concerns, please contact Thames Valley Police at 101 or Legoland Windsor Guest Services at 0871 222 2000.

The investigation remains an active priority, and all parties involved are requested to allow the investigative team to proceed undisturbed in their efforts to uncover the truth. Your understanding and cooperation are essential to the successful resolution of this matter.

The Child Abuse Investigation Unit appreciates the community's patience and trust as they delve deeper into the case. They urge anyone with relevant information to come forward and contact the authorities.

At Legoland Windsor, the focus remains on delivering unforgettable experiences for families. The park's staff are committed to ensuring the utmost safety and security for all visitors.

For the latest updates on the investigation, please follow Thames Valley Police or Legoland Windsor's official social media channels. For any concerns or inquiries, please contact Thames Valley Police at 101 or Legoland Windsor Guest Services at 0871 222 2000.

Together, we can help bring justice and closure to those affected and maintain the trust and integrity of our beloved community. Thank you for your continued support.

In the meantime, Legoland Windsor encourages families to enjoy their time at the theme park, creating cherished memories together. The management team assures visitors that all necessary measures are being taken to ensure their safety and enjoyment.

The Child Abuse Investigation Unit encourages anyone with any information, no matter how small, to come forward and share it with the authorities. Your cooperation is essential in ensuring the well-being of all members of our community.

Please remember that the investigation is an ongoing process, and updates will be provided regularly on Thames Valley Police and Legoland Windsor's official social media channels. If you require any assistance or have any concerns, please do not hesitate to contact Thames Valley Police at 101 or Legoland Windsor Guest Services at 0871 222 2000.

Thank you for your understanding and continued support during this time. Together, we can help bring justice and closure to those affected and maintain the trust and integrity of our beloved community.

In the spirit of transparency and collaboration, Legoland Windsor will be working closely with the Child Abuse Investigation Unit to address any concerns and ensure the safety and well-being of all guests. We encourage everyone to continue enjoying the park while we work together to resolve this matter.

If you notice any suspicious behavior or have any information that may be relevant to the investigation, please do not hesitate to report it to the authorities or park personnel. Your vigilance and cooperation are crucial in maintaining a safe and welcoming environment for all.

We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time, and will provide regular updates on any developments related to the investigation. Please follow Thames Valley Police and Legoland Windsor's official social media channels for the latest information.

Once again, thank you for your continued support and trust in Legoland Windsor. Together, we can ensure the safety and enjoyment of all visitors and create cherished memories that last a lifetime.

In the meantime, we want to assure all our valued guests that the safety and security of our park is our top priority. Rest assured that we have increased security measures in place to ensure the well-being of all our visitors.

In the interim, we encourage you to explore the various attractions and activities our park has to offer. Let the fun and excitement of the rides, shows, and exhibits take your mind off any worries.

Please remember to follow all safety guidelines and instructions provided by our staff. We want to make sure that everyone has a safe and enjoyable experience during their visit to our park.

Once again, we appreciate your understanding and cooperation during this time. If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. We are here to make your visit to our park an unforgettable experience.

In the meantime, feel free to indulge in the delightful array of dining options available throughout the park. Savor the flavors of various cuisines, from sweet treats to savory dishes.

Take a leisurely stroll through our beautiful gardens, admiring the vibrant colors and fragrances of the flowers. Or, relax and unwind in one of our tranquil seating areas, taking in the sights and sounds of the park.

For the more adventurous, we offer a range of thrilling experiences, including ziplining, rock climbing, and kayaking. Challenge yourself and push your limits, all while making lasting memories.

And don't forget to check out our souvenir shops, where you can find unique and special items to take home as a reminder of your visit to our park.

We are confident that you will find plenty to keep you entertained and engaged during your time here. And when you're ready, our team will be here to provide you with any information or assistance you may need.

Thank you once again for your patience and cooperation. We look forward to making your visit to our park a truly unforgettable experience.

As the sun begins to set, we invite you to experience another side of our park. Join us for a romantic dinner cruise on the lake or attend a breathtaking evening show.

Explore our night markets, where you can sample exotic delicacies and shop for handcrafted souvenirs. Or, take a guided night tour to discover the park's hidden gems and learn fascinating stories about its history.

For those seeking adventure, our nighttime activities offer a thrilling twist. Try out our glow-in-the-dark mini golf course or take a haunted house tour through our spooky forest.

Whatever your preference, we've got you covered with a wide range of experiences to make your night unforgettable. And remember, our friendly staff are always on hand to help you make the most of your visit.

Enjoy your time in our park and create memories that will last a lifetime.

As the stars twinkle in the night sky, your adventure continues. Indulge in a decadent dessert tasting session at our evening bazaar, or take a relaxing hot air balloon ride above the park for a stunning view of the lit-up landscape.

For music lovers, join us for a live concert or dance performance that will leave you enchanted. Or, unwind with a soothing yoga session by the lake, surrounded by the calming sounds of nature.

For the thrill-seekers, embark on a spine-tingling ghost tour or try your hand at our nighttime archery range. And for those who just want to relax, take a rejuvenating dip in our heated outdoor pool under the starlit sky.

No matter what you choose, we promise an unforgettable experience that will leave you with memories to cherish forever. Don't miss out on this magical night in our park.
